item.title: Please help with this issue
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

public void addStarter() { c.getItems().addItem(995,1000); c.getItems().addItem(1731, 1); c.getItems().addItem(554,200); c.getItems().addItem(555,200); c.getItems().addItem(556,200); c.getItems().addItem(1127,2); c.getItems().addItem(1381,1); c.getItems().addItem(1323,1); c.getItems().addItem(841,1); c.getItems().addItem(882,500); c.getItems().addItem(379,1); c.sendMessage("You receive your starter"); }

That removes all of the IP checking for starters. It doesn’t remove the actual methods inside the Connection class though, you can remove those yourself. However, this will most likely make it so people receive the starter every time they login, so you’ll have to change that too if you want.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Please help with this issue
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

To show you what clean code is (to my knowledge), I’m rewriting all of this shit for you.

public void addStarter() {
	int startersReceivedAmt = Connection.starters(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom);
	if (startersReceivedAmt < 2) {
		c.getItems().addItem(995,1000);
		c.getItems().addItem(1731, 1);
		c.getItems().addItem(554,200);
		c.getItems().addItem(555,200);
		c.getItems().addItem(556,200);
		c.getItems().addItem(1127,2);
		c.getItems().addItem(1381,1);
		c.getItems().addItem(1323,1);
		c.getItems().addItem(841,1);
		c.getItems().addItem(882,500);
		c.getItems().addItem(379,1);
		Connection.startersReceived(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom, startersReceivedAmt+1);
		c.sendMessage("You have recieved 1 out of 2 starter packages on this IP address.");
	} else {
		c.sendMessage("You have already recieved 2 starters!");
	}
}

Your code made absolutely no sense, to have two massive if-statements when only one is required (and other reasons).
Write the methods yourself.

P.S. Read up on conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help with this issue
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Alright, I guess I’ll help you again today since I logged off last night.

What source did you download?

Also the problem is (you probably already know) is that it logs your IP each time you receive a starter, and it can only log it twice.

Do you want to keep this feature or you can just remove it completely. It’s to prevent transferring starters between accounts, but there are more ways you can do it too.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help with this issue
item.dc:creator: @Aaroninsane Aaroninsane
item.description:
@Aaroninsane wrote:

Ok guys so i changed my starter to thispublic void addStarter() { if (!Connection.hasRecieved1stStarter(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom)) { c.getItems().addItem(995,1000); c.getItems().addItem(1731, 1); c.getItems().addItem(554,200); c.getItems().addItem(555,200); c.getItems().addItem(556,200); c.getItems().addItem(1127,2); c.getItems().addItem(1381,1); c.getItems().addItem(1323,1); c.getItems().addItem(841,1); c.getItems().addItem(882,500); c.getItems().addItem(379,1); Connection.addIpToStarterList1(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom); Connection.addIpToStarter1(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom); c.sendMessage("You have recieved 1 out of 2 starter packages on this IP address."); } else if (Connection.hasRecieved1stStarter(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom) && !Connection.hasRecieved2ndStarter(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom)) { c.getItems().addItem(995,1000); c.getItems().addItem(1731, 1); c.getItems().addItem(554,200); c.getItems().addItem(555,200); c.getItems().addItem(556,200); c.getItems().addItem(1127,2); c.getItems().addItem(1381,1); c.getItems().addItem(1323,1); c.getItems().addItem(841,1); c.getItems().addItem(882,500); c.getItems().addItem(379,1); c.sendMessage("You have recieved 2 out of 2 starter packages on this IP address."); Connection.addIpToStarterList2(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom); Connection.addIpToStarter2(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom); } else if (Connection.hasRecieved1stStarter(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom) && Connection.hasRecieved2ndStarter(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom)) { c.sendMessage("You have already recieved 2 starters!"); } but now when i spawn it says youve already had 2 starters and before that i was spawing with the original starter

Read full topic
